items.sentence: Tom plans to stay with us when he comes to Boston.
Tom poured a cup of coffee and offered it to Mary.
Tom probably has a good reason for not being here.
How could Tom and Mary even stay in the same room?
How could you get involved with a woman like that?
How could you take that job without consulting me?
How did we not know that this was going to happen?
I really want to be able to speak French fluently.
I suspect Tom and Mary went to Australia together.
You\'re not going to the picnic and that\'s final.
You\'re the only person I know who can\'t do that.
Tom is going to find out who did that, eventually.
Tom is going to have to deal with that on his own.
How did you convince Tom to wash your car for you?
How did you find out that Tom knew how to do that?
How did you persuade Tom to help you wash the car?
How do people celebrate the new year in Australia?
I\'m not sure anybody would be willing to help me.
I\'m not sure whether Tom can speak French or not.
Did you bring what you promised that you\'d bring?
